transcript.text: So, I don't think it's particularly
controversial for me to say that science
is amazing. From microorganisms to giant
galaxies, it encompasses everything in
between. And we want you to tell us
about it.
>> Open to all undergraduate students,
start talking is a great opportunity to
practice your communication of a STEM
topic of your choice in three specific
formats.
Whether it's your about your own
research or you might have an innovative
STEM idea that you think might change
the world or you are just passionate
about science in general, start talking
is the place for you.
>> You have 4 minutes to present and if you
win, you get 400 bucks. Now, if you want
to apply, first you have to submit
talking points. That's around 300 words
you have to submit. And then if you get
through from there, you'll get to go to
the grand final. As one of your judges,
I'll be looking for a science talk that
has creativity, that has clarity, and
one that connects to me. But now it's
your turn to start talking.
